name: GetAccountOwners
description:
Retrieve owners of a specific linked account.

Use this tool to list all the owners associated with a specific account. This can be helpful for verifying account ownership or managing account permissions.

parameters.name: ownership_object_id
parameters.description: The unique ID of the ownership object to retrieve owners from. This is required to specify which account's owners to list.

value_schema.description: The ID of the ownership object to fetch owners from.

parameters.name: linked_account_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the account to retrieve owners for. This is required to specify which account's owners you want to list.

parameters.name: pagination_ending_before
parameters.description: Cursor ID for pagination to fetch the previous page. Use the object ID from the start of the current list result.

value_schema.description: A cursor for use in pagination. `ending_before` is an object ID that defines your place in the list. For instance, if you make a list request and receive 100 objects, starting with `obj_bar`, your subsequent call can include `ending_before=obj_bar` in order to fetch the previous page of the list.

parameters.name: expanded_fields
parameters.description: List of fields to be expanded in the response. Specify field names to include more data in the response.

value_schema.description: Specifies which fields in the response should be expanded.

parameters.name: number_of_owners_to_return
parameters.description: Specify the number of account owners to retrieve, ranging from 1 to 100. Default is 10.

value_schema.description: A limit on the number of objects to be returned. Limit can range between 1 and 100, and the default is 10.

parameters.name: pagination_starting_after
parameters.description: Cursor for pagination to specify the starting point for the next page of results using an object ID.

value_schema.description: A cursor for use in pagination. `starting_after` is an object ID that defines your place in the list. For instance, if you make a list request and receive 100 objects, ending with `obj_foo`, your subsequent call can include `starting_after=obj_foo` in order to fetch the next page of the list.
